comment:
I really like this one for the days where I just want a nice whiskey to sip on. 

On the nose I get a ton of honey and butter biscuits (shortbread), cinnamon and vanilla. Most of that follows to the taste, mixed with raisins, sweet apples, pears, vanilla custard and buttery goodness. 

Slight, pleasent burn and long aftertaste of buttered biscuits with honey. Not a whiskey for peatheads, but perfect to sip while reading a good book or enjoying a movie.
Got big vanilla and a touch of leather on the nose.
Vanilla, cinnamon, cream, and lavender. Delicious.
Tried this at The Oak in Dublin restaurant last December. It wasn’t nearly as fantastic as their Shepherd’s Pie, but it paired well enough.
vel ballensaður og frútí samt þettur í gegn með vanillu. vel þess virði að taka flösku.

Day 7, 2017 advent. Sort of plain vanilla Irish whisky. Not bad in anyway, just not especially good either. Not bad, but not worth having a full bottle on hand either.  It was remarkably smooth, and easy to drink. Fruity, and well rounded. Recommend it neat at room temperature. Again, not bad, just too many others that are better.
Completely fine everyday whiskey.  Nothing too interesting though
Smooth and velvety, but a bit boring. Lacks complexity. A bit of candied pear, kind of like a Williams pear Schnaps. Not much else.
příjemná, ne kouř, sladší, levná (27€)... dobrá (ale jsou lepší na nákup)
Pear and a spicy vanilla with a creamy medium finish
definately Irish flavor, good...but probably not my taste to return to frequently.
Sweet but acidic on the nose. Very fruity and sweet on the palate - toffee like. Spiced finish.
A bit too harsh for me

I picked up the vanilla and a little bit of the cinnamon roll, but I was not able to pick up the pear in this whiskey. If I were to have an every day drinker I would prefer Writers Tears over this. Far smoother as an Irish whiskey, Writers Tears is superior to Roe &   Company and more than likely at a lower price point. This wasn’t bad, but not great either.
Way good when in ice and cooled down a smidge
Vanilla bean crème brûlée.  The crispy-sweet sugary topping lingers on the palate.  Custard through and through.  Delicious!
Mellow, sweet, very pleasant, with fruit, vanilla, brown sugar and woody notes

Very smooth, with just a touch of an alcohol smell on the nose. Definitely can taste the vanilla coming through. As others have said, its smooth and everyday drinkable, but kind of a one note whiskey. Pleasantly surprised though.
Spicy at first, then vanilla tone, with a rich sweet finish
Nicely balanced, clearly influenced by the bourbon barrel. Terrific neat. May buy a bottle for Irish whiskeys next weekend.
Very good. I like the sweetness and the smell in my nose. I like this whiskey
Hauch toffee, leicht medizinisch in der Nase, süße etwas Schärfe im Geschmack, kurzer Abgang
Not bad got the price. Tastes of vanilla, cream and Graham cracker.
Very light, smooth with a touch of oak and vanilla. Emphasis on light and smooth.
I like the vanilla; soft mouthfeel, easy sipper
